snippet: A federal judge said on Friday that there was sufficient evidence that Sulaiman Abu Ghaith conspired to kill Americans to allow the case to go to a jury.
abstract: Judge Lewis A Kaplan of Federal District Court in Manhattan rules that evidence that Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, top adviser to Osama bin Laden, conspired to kill Americans was 'dramatically more than merely sufficient' to allow the case to go to a jury.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge said on Friday that there was sufficient evidence that Sulaiman Abu Ghaith conspired to kill Americans to allow the case to go to a jury.

headline.main: Judge Rules Terror Case Should Go Before Jury
headline.print_headline: Judge Rules Terror Case Should Go Before Jury
